description: From Turkish bahşiş, from Persian بخشیش‎ (baxšiš, “present; an honorary or pecuniary gratuity; drink-money”) or بخشش‎ (baxšeš), from بخشیدن‎ (baxšidan, “to give, grant, bestow”).

entries.meaning: in the Middle East, southwest Asia and Eastern Europe: a bribe or tip.
(military slang) A minor wound that is severe enough to get a soldier sent away from the front.

verbs.description: baksheesh (third-person singular simple present baksheeshes, present participle baksheeshing, simple past and past participle baksheeshed)
